website_summaries.verdict: Combines reliable dimming ability, superior light, and versatile "smart" technology. By far the best dimmable option available today.
pros: Offers reliable compatibility and device pairing that's easy to set up
cons: Some know-how is required to use
Pricey, especially considering you only get one bulb

customer_reviews.title: Loses connections
customer_reviews.text: Why oh why did I not listen to those negative reviews. I bought two, one is ok, but the other keeps losing its connection. I have reset it so many times I gave up. I even updated the firmware. So after giving up on it, 3 days later it starts working again but only for about 3 days and it loses connection again.very undependable. Also cant get it to change from one preset to another. Light turns on at 5 % ...you wouldd dobetter with solar landscaping lights. Not happy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: They’ll work for a few weeks, then they’ll be paper weights.
customer_reviews.text: I bought 3 of these for my daughter’s room - a 3 year old who is afraid of the dark. For the first few weeks, they worked great. She would fall asleep with all of the lights on and I would slowly dim the bulbs to 1% and she was none the wiser. Fast forward to the past week... they don’t work. They’ll show in the app as 100% on when they’re not or they’ll flash on and off (which by the way has not helped my terrified 3 year old) or they’ll just disappear from the app. I’d recommend trying a more reliable brand.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Impressive light bulb
customer_reviews.text: Very cool, programmable light bulb. I got this for a few reasons. First off, it was on sale, which caught my initial attention. Secondly, I saw that it connects to my Alexa, which was a great bonus. Thirdly, it is programmable, which makes it convenient when I am away from my home for an extended amount of time. Another plus is the fact that it is dimmable. See the three photos--100%, 50%, 10%. So far, so good.
customer_reviews.author: B. Swenson

customer_reviews.title: Awesome products that only work half the time App stinks!!!
customer_reviews.text: I enjoy using these lights HOWEVER.... the app that goes with these really stinks. I mean I guess it’s the app unless it’s defective bulb but I own multiple Kasa products and all of a sudden I keep having to reload them all and the one bulb keeps disappearing completely it’s crazy annoying!!! So while in theory these are great I don’t know anymore. I also purchased TanTan brand plugs on a sale and so far no issues so maybe I will use that brand from no on. Disappointed for this price.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: KL110 good but very warm Yellow light
customer_reviews.text: The setup if the bulb is very easy if you have the Kasa app on your phone. It occasionally seems to loose its settings if disconnected from power so make sure it stays powered up all the time. The color is way on the 2700k side of the scale I’d say closer to 2500k. The light isn’t warm it yellow. Because you can’t change the temperature on this model KL110 you need to keep it by itself.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Not working after one day
customer_reviews.text: Initially this product worked well when installed. Two were initially installed and one is still working. After one day, one of them no longer connects. After four hours of troubleshooting, I attempted to contact customer service and was in a chat session for over two hours to only do the same things that I had done previous to this on my own. And this conversation took two hours due to customer service only asking or answering questions after 5-10 minute pauses between each. One of the worst customer service experiences I've had. I would highly NOT recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny

customer_reviews.title: Works great with Amazon Echo
customer_reviews.text: When went on a home automation kick setting up my christmas lights this year. Started because I didn't want to go out side to turn off the lights. After I fell down that rabbit hole I ended up with a couple Echo dots. These I'm using in nightstand lamps. These are easy to setup and there are instructions if you are unfamiliar. No hub is required for these. Each bulb works perfectly with the app and alexa so that is plus over a product like the Hue. The light given off by these can be a bright white light or a soft yellow. The dim with app or Alexa and the light given off is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Oates

customer_reviews.title: Has to be reset and reprogrammed all the time.
customer_reviews.text: If your power goes out you have to reset and reprogram everything. Sometimes you have to even when the power doesn't go out. Not worth the trouble.
customer_reviews.author: GNX

customer_reviews.title: REPLACEMENT PROCESS IS A TOTAL DISASTER!!
customer_reviews.text: I have multiple tp-link bulbs, plugs and switches. All work great. Like many other purchasers, this bulb suddenly became non-responsive. After numerous attempts to reset, reconnect, the bulb continued to malfunction. I’ve been on chat support for over an hour and they keep asking for things like firmware numbers that don’t display in the Kasa app because the bulb isn’t connected. While waiting for the technician to respond, I ordered a different bulb from another company. It will be delivered tomorrow. Tp-link/Kasa: if you are reading this, you totally failed to provide service to a previously loyal and satisfied customer. Shame on you. I’ve taken my business elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Jane M Phillips

customer_reviews.title: User-friendly Kasa app
customer_reviews.text: These bulbs were easy to install in my basement. I wanted to use them to set a schedule for lights to come on at night for the cat. I set them to come on during nighttime hours and go off during the day. Then, I don’t have to go around pulling the lightbulb changed twice a day. The Kasa app is very user friendly, and setup took minutes. It is straight forward. I have multiple TP-Link products that all integrate well with Amazon Alexa. Routines are easy to set up. Highly recommended! PS I bought The discounted used products from Amazon warehouse which are excellent and saved money.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Gave two stars for Amazon customer service
customer_reviews.text: Gave 2 stars for Amazon customer service. An extra star than I would have originally given if they hadn't tried to replace a new "faulty" one I bought. Second one does the same thing and won't connect! I'm no stranger to smart plugs and bulbs, I have multiple linked to my echo with no issues on my 2.4ghz network it calls for. They're various brands and it's clear this one does not work well
customer_reviews.author: Brooks_brittany

customer_reviews.title: Echo Updates and Kasa
customer_reviews.text: I bought a previous version in 2018 and this version in 2919. Everything worked well until the recent firmware update with Alexa Echo today (1/24/2020). The lights came on at the time Echo was updating, stayed on after Echo’s update then both dropped off the network. I did finally get them to work again a couple of hours later by resetting Kasa’s app time zone back and forth, then manually turning the lamps’ switches off then on again. Not sure why that worked but glad it did. This is the second time since buying my first Kasa Smart Home device that this kind of thing has happened. It never happens with my Jinvoo Smart Home devices.
customer_reviews.author: Carol P

customer_reviews.title: Great bulb, easy setup, no hub required
customer_reviews.text: It's a great bulb. I really like how it doesn't require a hub. It's only a few steps to get it set up then it's really easy from there. I'd definitely recommend! Update: I now own 4 and I'm planning on buying more whenever they go on sale again! To the people leaving 1 star reviews for connection issues. This is your ROUTER'S FAULT....not the bulb!! Invest in a GOOD ROUTER every couple years. Use range extenders or invest in a mesh network such as Google WIFI or Netgear's MOFI. You get what you pay for!!
customer_reviews.author: matt nelson

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable in multiple ways
customer_reviews.text: I got this last week and scheduled it when it arrived - the bulb has only been coming on when scheduled 45% of the time. And tonight it turned on unscheduled at midnight. I don’t know if there is something wrong with the program or bulb, or if the bulb is so unsecured that someone decided to hack it for fun - and honestly I don’t care, as the end result is the same: an unusable product that is actively damaging my sleep instead of helping me to gently wake as planned. I’ll be returning it. I don’t know if I’ll try another smart bulb with a better security reputation or not.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Great for our nursery
customer_reviews.text: We had an older generation of this light bulb and never had any issues with it (~4years). When we were setting up our nursery we chose to use this brand again and we’re super happy with them. The room is set up with four light bulbs and we use Alexa to control them. Easy to set up and even to link together. I like that there’s no “hub”. The lowest setting is perfect for nighttime diaper changes and the light can be controlled in the app when I don’t want to use the voice control.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Noisy & Flickering
customer_reviews.text: I am disappointed by the quality of this light bulb. Yes, it connects to Google Home and turns on. However, there is an audible constant buzzing noise, which becomes annoying after a few hours. To make matters worse, the bulb flickers! I tried to switch to a different socket but the problem persists. I'm not sure if I got a bad batch? I tried to give the lightbulb the benefit of the doubt and missed the return window. Now I'm stuck with this. Great.
customer_reviews.author: Sambat

customer_reviews.title: Nice improvement over the previous generation
customer_reviews.text: We have a bunch of the previous gen bulbs from TP-Link but they could be problematic as they were longer than a standard incandescent bulb. These new bulbs are basically the normal height, making them a lot easier to use in more fixtures. Overall performance is every bit as good as the old ones, although I'd love to see a higher output version. Dimming and color adjustment are smooth and responsive, no flickers, and no connectivity or other performance issues to speak of.
customer_reviews.author: csroc

customer_reviews.title: Connect to Alexa very easily
customer_reviews.text: I had bought from Lowe’s big box store a smart light from a company called Fiet. It was only $8.98. However I couldn’t get it to stay connected to my Wi-Fi after many attempts. I have other Kasa products I am happy with, so I returned the Fiet light, And ordered the Kasa smart bulb which came within 24 hours. It connected to my Wi-Fi first try works with Alexa just fine, and after five days now it’s still working fine. I have it on a schedule that you set up in Kasa app.
customer_reviews.author: bob114

customer_reviews.title: This works!
customer_reviews.text: I love using these light bulbs. Alexa works great with turning them on and off. Also on the separate Kasa app, a separate timer can be used to have lights go on and off at what ever time you set as an alarm. The only complaint I have is that I ordered two light bulbs and the second light bulb took a lot longer to set into the app. I was having issues setting up the particular wifi connection which took at least 30 mins to connect. Over all, product is really worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Jasmine Smith

customer_reviews.title: Program once and done
customer_reviews.text: I got my echo dots and Kasa TP Link plugs two years ago. Later I ordered Lightify bulbs. Over these two years the Kasa products have all ways worked and I have never had to reprogram. I just replaced the Lightify system with more Kasa mini plugs and bulbs. They program easy and once you enter your WiFi and password it remembers to pair the rest. Alexa notices them immediately and they are the app when you go there to setup routines. I didn’t use the Kasa app for two years. I did order a color bulb and have been playing with that app and it works well. I will be buying any future smart home products from Kasa.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Best Smart Home products on the market!
customer_reviews.text: I have many different brands of smart devices, using many different apps, and it is fair to say the entire KASA suite of products are my favorite. G Assistant and Alexa integration are perfect, setup is a breeze, scheduling them via KASA app works like a charm. Plus I can control all functions in Assistant apps or via voice using Alexa and G assistant. As I get more smart products, I will find it hard to get anything other than KASA products.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Mayer

customer_reviews.title: Great bulbs,,
customer_reviews.text: I have so many bulbs, it can get hard to remember what I named them. Easy to setup, no dropped signals, and I like the warm light emitted and the ability to dim. My oldest bulb is 4 years or older. I like that there’s no hub to add to my electronic clutter. I hope that kasa continues to make and support their products for years to come. I also have smart switches and their plugs for my heaters, electric fireplaces, and I use them on my TVs and wfh desk.
customer_reviews.author: magnolia127

customer_reviews.title: It's just ok
customer_reviews.text: This is just ok. Not sure it's worth the price. I set it in the app to turn on and off at a certain time every day and that just doesn't work. I have also set it up with my Alexa and it's the only thing she says she doesn't recognize even though it is named correctly. The light it puts out is just ok, very yellow. I wouldn't recommend.
customer_reviews.author: K. Duggan

customer_reviews.title: Love them!
customer_reviews.text: I don’t have Alexa and I’ve only had the bulbs for about two weeks, but I love being able to control them from my phone and set a schedule! I have the smart plugs made by this company and they’re so useful, i figured bulbs had to be great and I was right! It’s so nice when I get home at night not to have to fumble in the dark and not to be attacked by bugs! Love these bulbs!
customer_reviews.author: Clindsay1213

customer_reviews.title: Perfection
customer_reviews.text: Tried a different major brand smart plug for lights and they were dropping signal repeatedly. Took em back to big box store for refund and got two TP Link HS100 Kasa from Amazon. They've performed flawlessly since purchase months ago, so I bought this bulb for front porch. Absolutely simple easy installation and then one click set up with Alexa. Very highly recommended. Update: As expected flawless performance so far. Have easily adjusted brightness with Alexa app. Awesome product!
customer_reviews.author: Lance Lukenbill

customer_reviews.title: Hums in certain sockets
customer_reviews.text: The bulb will hum and make a sound when at max output in certain sockets. It was originally in my dinning room but that's where it hummed. Now I use it for my patio light and have had no problems or heard any noises from it since. 4 stars because you can't use it in any socket designed for 60 watt bulbs.
customer_reviews.author: Alton

customer_reviews.title: Something Different
customer_reviews.text: I thought I was buying the clear lens, but as it turned out these worked out just as well. I had the Kasa Smart Switches that plugged into the sockets, but replaced them with the smart bulbs. This gives me way more functionality, because I had to use a double-ended extension cord to reach the power source for both lights. Now I have outlets available on the cord, if I need them in a pinch. The bulbs can be dimmed, a great feature to have.
customer_reviews.author: William F Taylor

customer_reviews.title: The fact it uses your existing router is fantastic
customer_reviews.text: These are great bulbs and they come with there stand alone kasa app. My wife and I have an iPhone and this app runs perfectly. The app that you download to your iPhone runs your lights when your away. In other words, let’s say you left the living room light on but already left to work, simply open your app and turn it off. My wife uses it from her car to turn the lights in the house on. Easy to install each light and no hub is required. The fact it uses your existing router is fantastic!
customer_reviews.author: Rikki Rocktrap

customer_reviews.title: So simple to set up
customer_reviews.text: I just received these the other day to use for my porch lights. I have one by my door and one by my garage. They were so easy to set up. No connection issues at all. I set them up through the Kasa app and then used Alexa to add them to that app so that I can control everything in one app. I tested out the dimming capabilities and it worked fine but I doubt I'll ever use that functionality. You could set up the timer to dim it to certain percentages at specific times, which would be nice if I was using this inside.
customer_reviews.author: Debo

customer_reviews.title: Tp products are wonderful!!
customer_reviews.text: I use this lightbulb in my kitchen and in my hallway. My son was afraid of the dark, so we installed the lightbulb in the hall so he could ask Alexa to turn the hall light on before he even gets close, so he isn’t afraid of the dark hallway. It’s nice because I can dim it really low and set it like a nightlight for him also.
customer_reviews.author: Arika Evans

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t last.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been pretty impressed with my purchases from Kasa until now. That’s the main reason I bought this bulb. Paired easy. Worked great for 3 months. Then started to have connection issues. Another 2 months and it’s dead. Won’t reset. Won’t do anything. My hue lights are going on 7 years old now and I’ve never had an issue. You get what you pay for I suppose.
customer_reviews.author: JAS2

customer_reviews.title: Easy set-up, beautiful lights
customer_reviews.text: I love these bulbs. I have purchased 5 and not dosappointed. I wanted to stay with the same type because of the apps. If you have several brands then you have to remeber which lamp has which bulb. Works well with Alexa, no problems. I use the Kasa app to dim the lights. App set up is fast and easy. I've had to reconnect the bulbs to WiFi a few times when my mother has manually turned the light off/on, but had no problems. Alexa is more on/off but will dim with voice commands too. Beautiful warm light. Not dissapointed and have had several lights over a year. Great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: KL120 Best for Lights with Covers
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 KL120 for a ceiling fan I have. The KL120 is a lower profile then other models. My ceiling fan light has a cover has limited space and other TP Link bulbs would not fit. Pros: low profile, easy set up, works with alexa and Google home, dimmable and tunable (white or yellow). App is also solid and it seems like TP Link updates it. Cons: a little pricey, bulb light is not round so the light angle doesn't seem to be as good as previous model.
customer_reviews.author: Ad A

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: Smart bulbs are very expensive but this is the best one for this price range by far. I'm slowly making all the lights in my house smart bulbs so I can have them all on schedules. Right now I have 2 of these and 1 of another brand and this one is by far way more reliable and easier to set up. While I have seen more expensive ones that are better they are not affordable especially since light bulbs have the option to blow out spending 60$ on one isn't feasible. This one is the best bang for your buck guaranteed.
customer_reviews.author: Aly Childers

customer_reviews.title: Flickers and blinks, bad connectivity
customer_reviews.text: Unlike other Kasa Wi-Fi bulbs that I have, this one blinks and flickers constantly. The outlet never had an issue with previous Kasa bulbs. Sluggish reaction time with app and doesn’t remain on previous brightness setting as it should. It does turn on and off with sunrise/set. Need to return.
customer_reviews.author: Gravytrain

customer_reviews.title: Probably the best non-Hue bulbs
customer_reviews.text: I have to say, TP Link has hit a home run with their Kasa smart home products. I've used their bulbs, switches, and plugs and they are my go-to brand when I need something new. Their app is light and easy to use and the integration with both Alexa and Google Home is excellent; very easy to set up and use. The Hue bulbs may be better but they are also significantly more expensive and never go on sale.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon G

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied Customer
customer_reviews.text: These lights were easy to set up with the Kasa app and Alexa recognized them immediately. In the short two weeks we have had them, they survived both a power outage followed by an internet only outage. The lights came back on-line immediately without any action on our part. The only issues we have had thus far is a "dumb" human turning off the light switch.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to install
customer_reviews.text: This is the third Kas Smart light bulb I have bought. The other 2 I have had about a year and they still work like new. I use them with Alexa and use the different settings. I love that I can dim the bulb when watching tv or brighten when I need to read. I also bought my mother one for Christmas and she loves it. I also have two of their smart plugs, which work really well but not as well as these lights. Will probably buy more when they run a sale.
customer_reviews.author: Janet

customer_reviews.title: Pretty awesome!
customer_reviews.text: The set up with registering for the kasa app, then adding it to the alexa app was the easiest thing. Lol. I'm not sure why some people had trouble. And I don't work in IT. It's bright enough for my bedroom. I liked the changes in light colors. I love the dimmable feature. Sometimes I just want a lower light and it'll save me energy. So far so good!
customer_reviews.author: LORA

customer_reviews.title: A Great TP-Link Product
customer_reviews.text: I own several of these bulbs that are in use in two outdoor lights, bedrooms, living room and our home office. All work well. Some are now in their second year and are going strong. The last order I received is the newer version which pairs with the app and Alexa much easier. You can't go wrong with these quality products. As with all smart home products that operate with wi-fi, your mileage may vary if your wi-fi is compromised by walls or other local interference.
customer_reviews.author: TopDog1

customer_reviews.title: Easiest setup.
customer_reviews.text: Easiest of the brands to set up. I like that it’s dimmable. You can tell Alexa to “turn on den light 20%” if you want a little mood lighting or tell her 100% if you need more light. Also, if you have multiple lights, you can ask Alexa to “turn on or off all lights”.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Barker

customer_reviews.title: Terrific lights
customer_reviews.text: We have a bunch of these around the house and they have worked without issue. I have them outside and in rooms all over and they do exactly what they are supposed to do when they are expected to do them (go on and off). The setup is very easy with the Kasa app for anyone who is technologically challenged. If you can screw in a lightbulb and click on an app, you too can enjoy a Kasa wifi lightbulb in your home too!
customer_reviews.author: NBL

customer_reviews.title: Had trouble at first...
customer_reviews.text: I was up in the air about this light bulb. It did not want to work properly or connect to the internet. I would start working then stopped. I just took it out of my lamp for a couple of weeks and tried again, then it started working. Update: still having trouble. Goes offline often. Difficult to connect to the internet. The plug works way better. If I could return this item I would.
customer_reviews.author: LiveLife2Laugh2Love

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: it has been easy to integrate with both my Echo and Google speaker. Stumbling around in the dark for the light switch has become a thing of the past! And I love that when I've reached perfect comfy at night I dont have to get out of bed to turn off the lamp. Preset routines make sure my dog isnt in the dark when the sun goes down, and also that I wake up to a soft glow with my alarm in the morning. I'm definitely getting more of these!
customer_reviews.author: AngieT.

customer_reviews.title: More tp link trash.
customer_reviews.text: Thought I would give them another chance. Wished I wouldn't have. All my other devices work well and pair easy. All tp products don't. Maybe TP works with apple. IDK.
customer_reviews.author: Cramers

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: I've been wanting a smart bulb for a long time but never wanted to spend that much money on them. A friend recommended this brand and I'm so glad I went for it. The bulb itself is a great, warm hue and it paired easily with both my phone and Google mini. Now I can turn it on as I'm walking to my room and don't have to fumble around in the dark looking for the lamp switch!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Alexa turn the light on
customer_reviews.text: Works great my second one. Make sure you tell your wife that it is a special bulb. That Alexa turns on and off. She thought it wasn’t working right and threw it away. I did not find out until one night I told alexa to turn her light off it it would not work. Hahaha
customer_reviews.author: Frank Goins

customer_reviews.title: Light Bulbs have a wonderful light spectrum and really bright or dim.
customer_reviews.text: These light bulbs are capable of both being very bright and very dim. Occasionally I get an issue with the Echo not turning one of the light bulbs in a group on and I have to repeat the command to have the echo turn on all of the light bulbs in the group, i.e. every light bulb in the bedroom. The light bulbs are easy to setup with the Kasa app, but you do need some basic computer literacy to create an account and connect to wifi network.
customer_reviews.author: hector999

customer_reviews.title: Works with Alexa without needing a hub
customer_reviews.text: It’s a good solid quality Bulb. It’s also cheaper than the other heavy duty smart bulbs on the market. I bought it because it is a TP Link Kasa Smart home product and so are the rest of my smart devices. They work right out of the box with Alexa. I also love the Kasa App for smart phones. You also don’t need a hub like some other brand-name smart bulbs to connect with Alexa.
customer_reviews.author: Cast Iron Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Nice Smart Bulb that is Dimmable
customer_reviews.text: I bought another one and installed it using the Kasa app for the first time. The first smart bulb I used the Alexa app awhile back. The installation took me some time to install after three attempts, but I did manage to install it on the fourth attempt. I have another smart bulb coming and the next one shall be easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: Tyson

customer_reviews.title: So reliable!!!
customer_reviews.text: I tried a couple off the off brands but came back to the tried and true TP Link Kasa WiFi bulb. Unlike the other brands, TP Link bulbs consistently stay connected to my WiFi and integrates with Alexa easily. The controls are easy too. I use mine for my front porch light because I can set the on/off for sunset and sunrise without rewiring the switch. I highly recommend the TPLink Kasa light bulb!
customer_reviews.author: @LSieu

customer_reviews.title: Light was too dim
customer_reviews.text: These bulbs were definitely too dim and they did not match the other warm white bulbs I have. The color was similar to a big light. I really wanted them to work, but they did not look the same. Unfortunately I had to return. I am a huge fan of this company and own several products. They integrate very easily and work well with Alexa.
customer_reviews.author: AndrewC

customer_reviews.title: Unflattering and unpleasant color tone if you care about ambiance
customer_reviews.text: The color is a very unflattering and unpleasant green/blue tone like an interrogation room or cheap motel would use. Brightness level doesn't go low enough for evening relaxation. I also bought the tunable version hoping to have a warm color but even on the warmest setting, still had that unattractive tone. If you don't have any sense of atmosphere, it is practical. But if ambiance is important to you, search on.
customer_reviews.author: BonWil

customer_reviews.title: Like the features but ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to go on my garage light fixture and unfortunately, like every “smart” lightbulb I have bought this one has begun malfunctioning after a couple of months of use. It has started constantly flickering. While the on/off features are great, I will be pulling this as it no longer works properly
customer_reviews.author: Philip

customer_reviews.title: Loses connection once in a while
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like these. I have these installed in my bedroom and control them using Google Home. But once n a while(every 2 weeks), they would be disconnected so that Google Home nor the Kasa app would be able to control them. Other than that, I have no problem with them. My house is using Google Wifi routers.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Undefined

customer_reviews.title: NO CONNECTION TO KASA WIFI.  BUYER BUY AT OWN RISK GOOD LUCK 🤞
customer_reviews.text: Beare, this product has a hard time connecting to the internet. I tryed the lads app and WiFi it would not connect. I also tryed my home internet/ WiFi it wouldn’t connect. I wanted it to work but it wouldn’t connect. I thought I had a defective bulb. Sent back. Reorder. But still no connection. So I just gave up and return it. This didn’t work for me. It’s not easy
customer_reviews.author: Lite

customer_reviews.title: Very Quiet Switch
customer_reviews.text: I have a bunch of the TP-Link smart plugs and they work very well. The only thing is that they make a little click sound when you turn them on and off. Not a big deal, but there it is. The smart bulbs are silent when turning off and on. All in all I like have the plugs and I like having the bulbs for different applications. Nice to have options.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel D. Self

customer_reviews.title: Too many steps
customer_reviews.text: After having this for a while, I’m not certain I like the steps I have to take to tune the light bulb on. Right now I have to go into settings and change the wifi to the light and the go back to the app to turn my home wifi back on. And then I have to repeat the same steps to tuen it off. Am I doing something wrong?
customer_reviews.author: Nasco

customer_reviews.title: Easy set-up, works great
customer_reviews.text: I’d already downloaded the Kasa app a few years ago for a TP-Link smart plug I have, so all I had to do was install the bulb and connect it to my network. Literally took about three minutes. It’s in an outdoor fixture and the brightest white setting lights up my entire front yard. The scheduling feature works great. It’s set to come on at sunset, off at sunrise. Flawless!
customer_reviews.author: mrkite123

customer_reviews.title: Good dimming smart bulb
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these now mainly for the dimming function as the smart plugs I already owned didn’t support dimming. They both work really well. I like having one in our bedroom for night reading. The setup was really easy and they don’t make any noise when turning on or off which is nice.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua MacDonald

customer_reviews.title: It works as described.
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to setup and operate. The app is intuitive and it is easy to set custom brightness shortcuts and schedules. I have one as my porch light and I have it come on and sunset and turn back off and sunrise. It's really nice and I don't have to think about it. Unless I am missing something, I don't think it is possible to set a schedule based upon a group of lights (if you have two bulbs in a overhead light for example, you have to set it for each individual bulb). It's not a big deal, but if someone from TPLink reads this maybe they can add it in.
customer_reviews.author: Nasty Nate

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use.  Integrates well with Google Home.
customer_reviews.text: I have a lot of TP-Link plugs, cameras, switches, and bulbs throughout my house along with some other brands. I've found the TP-Link/Kasa devices the easiest to install and the most reliable. This bulb was no different. Integration with Google Home is seamless. As soon as I get it installed with the Kasa app, it shows up right away in the Google Home app.
customer_reviews.author: Mikey

customer_reviews.title: Works With My Alexa Dot/Spot
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bulb to place in a closet where the pull string had broken. Now I can just tell my Amazon Spot, “Alexa, turn on the light” and I have instant light to see my clothes! I did have some trouble installing it on the first try (I tested it on a lamp, then couldn’t get it to re-sync to the closet) so I recommend installing it in its final location from the start.
customer_reviews.author: Kat D.

customer_reviews.title: Works, but not well.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these after a security issue at my house happened, I wanted the lights outside to come on when it got dark out. I wanted them to stay on all night until the morning and go off then. These don't play nicely with Google Home, and didn't want to come on and go off on any kind of schedule. I had to go into the app and turn them on/off manually each time. It was disappointing as they said they did. Also, getting them to pair initially was more of a headache than it really needed to be.
customer_reviews.author: S. Dragoo

customer_reviews.title: Kasa has the best app
customer_reviews.text: Kasa was recommended to me by a friend. Another friend has another brand and with comparing apps, Kasa has the system down. Easy to add bulbs (and switches) to the Kasa program. Just have your Wi-Fi code ready and follow the directions provided. Once installed on the Kasa app, the bulbs work great with Alexa or the Kasa app on my cell phone. With the bulb, you can dim the light with either Alexa or the Kasa app. A nice feature!
customer_reviews.author: CA lady

customer_reviews.title: missing a feature
customer_reviews.text: These bulbs don't have one feature that the smart plugs have that I really wanted which was to be able to put them on away mode so that they will turn off and on at random times when I'm not home. If they can integrate away mode into the light bulbs like they have with their plugs I would give these a five star review
customer_reviews.author: Don V.

customer_reviews.title: Easy Setup - Mediocre Light Performance
customer_reviews.text: Bought some TP-Link WiFi lightbulbs. Very easy to add to the Kasa application. I like the easy integration with both the Kasa application and Alexa. I am disappointed with the light output. I think the output is is complicated by the yellowness of the light. Other light brands allow some adjustment between yellow and white. This light does not.
customer_reviews.author: David L

customer_reviews.title: Easiest smart bulb I ever installed
customer_reviews.text: Easiest smart bulb I ever installed, Installed in about two minutes works perfectly there’s another brand that begins with an L that’ll take you about two hours to install, this seems to be much better and easier the app is really a breeze to operate no complications
customer_reviews.author: Larry Peraino

customer_reviews.title: Best thing since electric lighting
customer_reviews.text: I love these things. The way Kasa lets you set routines and integrates with Alexa without any need for a hub or anything is super convenient. I honestly get annoyed at my "dumb lights" for making me flip a switch and am making all lights in my house Kasa bulbs over time. Will definitely purchase again!
customer_reviews.author: Angela R.

customer_reviews.title: Love the bulb, hate the schedule feature.
customer_reviews.text: I have many Kasa plugs, but this was my first bulb. I like the brightness and dimming functionality. It works well with Alexa. My only issue has been that the scheduling doesn’t function like the plugs. The bulb stays on well after I programmed it to shut off. If the bulb worked like the plugs, I’d give the product 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: jaws

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Was working with a WINK hub for a number of smart light bulbs. What a nightmare. Realized I never had a problem with the KASA plug, so I looked into that brand again. What a pleasant surprise! Worked right out of the box AS STATED, there's a surprise for ya. Easy set up and control. Couldn't be happier. Well, actually, if KASA made brighter watt bulbs, that would be nice....
customer_reviews.author: Muscman

customer_reviews.title: Works well with Google Home here
customer_reviews.text: Flawless integration with Google Home once the app is installed. Can command several lights off, on, dim with one spoken line. Much better than previous Zigbee bulbs we had. Also works after power failures without having to reinitialize.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Cousins

customer_reviews.title: Works with Alexa.
customer_reviews.text: Just as bright on full power as the 60 watt equivalent CFL it replaced. Wish they had a 100 watt version for my reading lamp. Added it to the Kasa app on my phone, added the Kas skill to my Alexa devices, and the lamp showed up a few hours later. Easy voice control. Can't comment on longevity yet.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry T

customer_reviews.title: Awesome smart bulbs!
customer_reviews.text: I have some Phillips smart bulbs that won’t connect without a bridge, and I can’t connect a bridge because it won’t work with my router. I’m not going to replace my router just for some lightbulbs, so I bought this. No hub or bridge needed! For real. I screwed it in, added it to the app and have had zero issues. And they’re way cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Chickens love it
customer_reviews.text: Using it for the chickens. They need 16 hours of light each day. Simple to use the phone app to adjust the schedule as daylight changes. Much better than trying to use a standard outlet timer. Plus you can adjust the brightness and set it to come on slowly
customer_reviews.author: Buck Rogers

customer_reviews.title: Dimmable, easy set up.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up, one you open the packaging there's a card that tells you to download the app. Once you open up the app it walks you through set up. I had the light up and running in no time. There was an update to the firmware once I completed set up. I only wish the bulb let me change colors but I'll live. The app also shows how much energy is used over the life of the product.
customer_reviews.author: Babs

customer_reviews.title: Dependable - Works with Google
customer_reviews.text: Using this with my Google Home by integrating with TP Link Kasa. I was previously using a C by GE bulb, which kept disconnecting from my WiFi. I had to keep turning the thing on manually...sometimes 2 or 3 times a day.(defeats the purpose) This Kasa lamp has worked flawlessly for several months now. I am a very happy camper!
customer_reviews.author: David T.

customer_reviews.title: Great bulb
customer_reviews.text: I love being able to control the lights with our echo. This bulb is great. Its bright and we can dim it as we see fit. So far we haven't had any pro lems with it. If we aren't home I can use my phone to turn on the lights so that we aren't walking in to a dark house. We love it.
customer_reviews.author: kolohe

customer_reviews.title: Easy to setup and easy to control
customer_reviews.text: I already had the Kasa app for a plug I bought. So I had already gone through the setup of a product once. The good thing was, because I had already set-up one thing, Alexa just wanted to know if I wanted her to control this smartlight too. I do love the fact that I can change this bulbs color temperature to match another light I have in the same room. And I can dim it when needed, though not through Alexa...but through the app on my phone.
customer_reviews.author: Thom Zelenka

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I use it as a porch light, and have it set on a schedule (you easily do this with the app you download for it) I set it at around 50% power, not too bright, but not too dim and uses less electricity that way. Works great!!!
customer_reviews.author: GoodKnight

customer_reviews.title: So easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I received two of these today and I have to say that they are probably one of the easiest wireless items you can set up. They do not require a hub but they do require the Kasa app (which is free). Simply download the app, add a device (in this case it was a light bulb) and follow the directions on your phone. They are also just as simple to add to Alexa.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Ketchum

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy, won't stay connected
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy! Never stays connected, I have kasa cameras and several plugs that I love that are in same house and always are connected with no issue. These bulbs never stay connected so they never work. Tried contacting company and they give me run around and say this or that is reason...don't buy
customer_reviews.author: Newc41

customer_reviews.title: Makes an everyday task just a little simpler
customer_reviews.text: Love these light bulbs. Nice to have the option to turn them off and on via Alexa and also from my iPhone if I am not at home. I have several throughout the house and I set them up to turn on automatically. In Alexa, I set up a “routine” that when I go to bed I say “Alexa, good night”. Alexa then turns off all the lights.
customer_reviews.author: Noreen M

customer_reviews.title: Worth the extra money
customer_reviews.text: This purchase makes my fifth and sixth Kasa smart bulbs, but because I purchased these for lamps I've had made for my bedroom, I wanted the warm, tunable bulbs this time. I purchased a cheaper brand, which only resulted in a trip to the shipping location to send back. The Kasa didn't disappoint and synched instantly with the app and Alexa.
customer_reviews.author: LAC

customer_reviews.title: FINALLY!
customer_reviews.text: Finally a product that works with my Alexa Show! I've tried Philips and Sengled. Do your self a favor: don't order from those guys if you plan to integrate your lights with just Alexa. Also, no hub is required if you have Alexa Show. Bonus!
customer_reviews.author: JustLauren

customer_reviews.title: Waste of Money
customer_reviews.text: Worked great with the app and with Alexa for two months. Then, it stopped communicating with Alexa and would only work with the Kasa app. I tried uninstalling/reverting to default settings, cutting power altogether, connecting to different WiFi, firmware updates (there were none). I last tuned it to 50% and now it's completely unresponsive and stuck, on 50%, no matter what I do. Beyond the return period so I'm stuck, too. I have a second bulb that I bought a month after the one that's gone bad. I'll update if it does the same.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Eureka!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this light bulb!!! I was able to get it working with my 3rd gen Echo Dot using an iPhone 8 in under 10 minutes! And it works exactly as promised. This is such a joy because this is the 4th brand of smart bulb I've used but by far the easiest to set up. Brilliant!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Great! This version does not come on after a power outage
customer_reviews.text: We had a previous model of this lightbulb and I was annoyed that every time we had a power outage, the smart bulbs would all turn themselves on. That worried me that they could all turn on while we're traveling. I'm happy to say that this newer model isn't displaying that behavior.
customer_reviews.author: Saliandra

customer_reviews.title: Edison, never dreamed light bulbs could ever do what this light bulb can do!
customer_reviews.text: Works great and was easy to setup with phone app. Works well with "Alexa" and "OK Google" You can schedule it to turn on or off at set static times. Wish there was a scheduling option for on or off at local sunset or sunrise, that would be nice.
customer_reviews.author: GEO

customer_reviews.title: The best smart bulb out there
customer_reviews.text: Love these bulbs. Love how I can set the brightness of them. Works great with my Alexia or can use my iPhone. Alexia will even turn it on when I schedule it to. No coming home to darkness. Won’t ever get any other brand. These are the best. No hub. No special lamp. Just screw it in, download the app, hook it to Alexia and done.
customer_reviews.author: K. Day

customer_reviews.title: Good bright light bulb
customer_reviews.text: This light bulb works grear with the Echo Dot. Have never had an issue with it loosing connectivity and the brightness is perfect for my bedroom. So much better to tell Alexa to to turn on the bedroom light from downstairs & especially helpful with having an old home with very few light switches.
customer_reviews.author: Tom S.

customer_reviews.title: These are awesome
customer_reviews.text: Set up was easy, You can use as regular bulb (just don't flip switch on off on real fast. It resets them) Love the dimming feature just say Alexa set ***light to a number from 1 to 100% this is great feature and bulb is really bright at 100%.
customer_reviews.author: KERRY

customer_reviews.title: Flickering
customer_reviews.text: I bought these at end of August they were easy to configure with Alexa and worked just fine until this morning. The lights in one room flickered and no longer work with Alexa. I'm back to using them like regular lights with them flickering from high to a dimmer setting. I have unscrewed them, then put them back in after about an hour with no change.
customer_reviews.author: Faron S.

customer_reviews.title: Up and running in less than three minutes
customer_reviews.text: I had this up and running in less than three minutes, like the El Cheapo socket (ASIN B07R8KKBR7) that I wasted 15 minutes of my life on. Everything in the TP Link/Kasa environment works flawlessly. I'm so glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Athleisure Ninja, Sandrine!

customer_reviews.title: Love this bulb!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a bulb to go with my Kasa system and this was perfect. I thought I would only use it as a security system for scheduled on-off lighting in my living room when I was away on vacation. The brightness is great. I find I use it everyday since I can turn the lamp on before I get home or in the mornings before I go downstairs. I would highly suggest this product.
customer_reviews.author: BronxxGirl

customer_reviews.title: Great Bulb
customer_reviews.text: This light bulb is awesome! I have it set on a schedule and I can control it with my phone or Google Home. I really like being able to see the usage and the energy usage comparison between it and standard 60W bulb so you can see how much electricity you're saving.
customer_reviews.author: Levi C.

customer_reviews.title: Automation options are great, app control is slow and buggy
customer_reviews.text: All of my various TP-Link bulbs are slow to update & respond via the app. If you want interactive control (e.g. on/off & dim control through the app it’s not great. Plus the reset bulb routine (Switch on & off 3 times using light switch) is too easy to trigger for my 3 year old and the re-set-up process is super slow and painful. If you want to set some pre-made routines that’s a whole different story and where it’s got a pretty great feature set.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Great smart bulbs
customer_reviews.text: Tp link smart products are really great and valuable options to make your home an smart house. They works properly without interruptions and excellent and easy integration with Alexa. Easy to install, just plug in, follow a few steps on Kasa app and that’s all.
customer_reviews.author: Javier Lozano

customer_reviews.title: Easy to setup with Google Home
customer_reviews.text: I had to buy more of these so we could easily turn off all the lights in our bedroom without having to get up. Also easy to setup on a schedule to turn on in the morning as part of an alarm. Easier to use than Philips Hue
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Buyer's Remorse
customer_reviews.text: The bulbs regularly disconnect from the wifi, becoming inoperable (the wifi signal is strong, so that's not the problem). Further, these bulbs were advertised as not needing a hub and capable of being used as an "alarm clock". However, if you want to use these as an "alarm clock" or use a handful of other features, you need to buy a separate compatible router.
customer_reviews.author: Reluctant Consumer

product_meta.title: Kasa Smart Light Bulb, LED Smart WiFi Alexa Bulbs works with Alexa and Google Home,A19 Dimmable,2.4Ghz,No Hub Required, 800LM Soft White(2700K), 10W(60W Equivalent)(KL110)
product_meta.description: Style:A19 Dimmable WhiteSmart Wi-Fi LED bulb with dimmable soft white protocols supported: IEEE 802.11b/g/n; System requirement: Android 4.1 or higher iOS 9.0 or higher; Wireless type: 2.4GHz 1T1R.
feature_bullets: Dimmable Kasa Smart’s dimmable light bulb has a dimming range from 1 percent to 100 percent; Set the right brightness for any mood or activity; Turn your bulb to full brightness to get your Kids up in the morning or dim it enough for them to fall asleep at night

No hub required: The Kasa smart Wi-Fi light bulb, dimmable connects to your home’s secure Wi Fi network; No need for a hub or extra equipment; All you need is your smartphone, the Kasa Smart app and a Wi-Fi connection to start controlling your bulb from anywhere

Control from anywhere: Control your smart light bulb from anywhere with your smartphone using the Kasa smart app (iOS, Android); Smoothly dim the brightness of your light bulb from anywhere with the app

Voice control: Use simple voice commands to control your Kasa smart dimmable light bulb with any Amazon Alexa, Google Assistant or Microsoft Cortana; Just tell your voice assistant to dim your lights and set the perfect mood for movie night
Note: Requires a secured 2.4 gigahertz Wi-Fi network connection. Typical Lumen output - 800lm

specifications.Included Components: 1 Kasa Smart Light Bulb, Dimmable, Quick Installation Guide
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars2,843 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
